intro: Rumicastrum oblongum, commonly known as the longleaf rumicostemon, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. Its fruit is a capsule that dehisces to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal. The species is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought conditions.
